svg.text: ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ VARIANCE REDUCTION TECHNIQUES │ ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ │ │ CUPED (Pre-experiment data) │ │ ├── Best for: Metrics with strong autocorrelation │ │ ├── Typical reduction: 20-50% │ │ └── Example: Use last month's revenue to adjust │ │ │ │ Stratification │ │ ├── Best for: Heterogeneous populations │ │ ├── Typical reduction: 10-30% │ │ └── Example: Stratify by country, device type │ │ │ │ Post-stratification │ │ ├── Best for: When you can't pre-stratify │ │ ├── Typical reduction: 5-20% │ │ └── Example: Adjust after experiment for demographics │ │ │ │ Triggered Analysis │ │ ├── Best for: Rare event experiments │ │ ├── Reduction: Varies │ │ └── Example: Only count users who saw the change │ │ │ └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
